passage.title: A perfect egg
passage.paragraph: A young man comes to the great artist Da Vinci. He wants to learn drawing. Da Vinci gives him an egg to draw. The young man works quickly and shows it to the artist. "Draw it again," says Da Vinci.
The young man draws another egg, but Da Vinci asks him to do it again and again. The young man feels unhappy.
"I can finish drawing an egg in two minutes. Why do you keep me waiting? Please teach me how to draw."
Da Vinci smiles and says, "Yes, you can. But it takes years to draw a perfect egg."
